scenarios.description: While walking to class, you see someone unknowingly drop a $20 bill. You’d have to run to return it, but you could really use the money yourself... What will you do?

choices.text: Run to catch up to them, even if it makes you late for class
choices.verse: Proverbs 3:27 - 'Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to act.'

choices.text: Call out to them. If they don’t hear you, keep the money.
choices.verse: (They don't hear you..) Deuteronomy 22:1 - 'Do not ignore your fellow Israelite’s lost property. You must return it to them.'

choices.text: Keep the money. They don’t even realize they've lost it.
choices.verse: Exodus 20:15 - 'You shall not steal.' (Even 'finding' what isn't yours can be a form of theft)

scenarios.description: You notice a classmate being bullied at lunch. They're clearly distressed. What do you do?

choices.text: Confront the bullies and sit with the student
choices.verse: Proverbs 31:8-9 - 'Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves... defend the rights of the poor and needy.'

choices.text: Tell a teacher later if you remember
choices.verse: James 4:17 - 'If anyone knows the right thing to do and fails to do it, it is sin.'

choices.text: Stay quiet - you don't want to become a target
choices.verse: John 15:13 - 'Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.'

scenarios.description: Your friend asks to copy your homework. You worked hard on it, but they're struggling...

choices.text: Refuse but offer to tutor them
choices.verse: Galatians 6:2 - 'Carry each other’s burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ.'

choices.text: Let them copy your homework
choices.verse: Proverbs 11:3 - 'The integrity of the upright guides them, but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.'

choices.text: Report them to the teacher
choices.verse: Ephesians 4:15 - 'Speak the truth in love...'

scenarios.description: An elderly neighbor needs help shoveling snow but you have plans with friends...

choices.text: Cancel plans and help joyfully
choices.verse: Matthew 5:16 - 'Let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'

choices.text: Help briefly then leave
choices.verse: Colossians 3:23 - 'Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord...'

choices.text: Pretend you didn't see them
choices.verse: Luke 10:30-37 - The Good Samaritan parable ('Which of these three do you think was a neighbor...?')

scenarios.description: A homeless man outside the grocery store asks for food. Your wallet is empty but you have your own lunch...

choices.text: Give him your sandwich and pray with him
choices.verse: Matthew 25:35 - 'For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat... whatever you did for the least of these, you did for me.'

choices.text: Share half your food but keep walking
choices.verse: Luke 3:11 - 'Anyone who has two shirts should share with the one who has none...'

choices.text: Avoid eye contact - you worked hard for that meal
choices.verse: 1 John 3:17 - 'If anyone has material possessions and sees a brother in need but has no pity, how can the love of God be in them?'

scenarios.description: You overhear friends spreading rumors about someone in your youth group. What's your response?

choices.text: Defend them publicly and confront the gossip
choices.verse: Ephesians 4:29 - 'Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what helps build others up...'

choices.text: Change the subject but don't intervene
choices.verse: Proverbs 26:20 - 'Without wood a fire goes out; without gossip a quarrel dies down.'

choices.text: Listen quietly but don't repeat it
choices.verse: Leviticus 19:16 - 'Do not go about spreading slander among your people...'

scenarios.description: A new student from another country sits alone at chapel. They seem uncomfortable with the worship style...

choices.text: Sit with them and explain what's happening
choices.verse: Romans 15:7 - 'Accept one another, then, just as Christ accepted you...'

choices.text: Smile but stay with your friend group
choices.verse: James 2:1 - 'Believers in glorious Lord Jesus Christ must not show favoritism.'

choices.text: Assume they want space and do nothing
choices.verse: Hebrews 13:2 - 'Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers...'

choices.description: Your church is debating whether to host refugees. Some members fear it might risk safety... What do you advocate?

choices.text: Push to welcome them wholeheartedly
choices.verse: Leviticus 19:34 - 'The foreigner residing among you must be treated as your native-born. Love them as yourself...'

choices.text: Suggest limited support through donations
choices.verse: James 2:15-16 - 'Suppose a brother or sister is without clothes and daily food. If you say, ‘Go in peace...’ but do nothing...'

choices.text: Vote against - 'We should help our own first'
choices.verse: Matthew 25:40 - 'Truly I tell you, whatever you did for the least of these... you did for me.'

choices.description: You accidentally break a museum exhibit. No one saw. The repair cost would empty your savings...

choices.text: Confess immediately and offer payment
choices.verse: Numbers 5:7 - 'They must confess their sin and make full restitution...' + Luke 19:8 (Zacchaeus)

choices.text: Leave anonymously with cash
choices.verse: Proverbs 28:13 - 'Whoever conceals their sins does not prosper, but the one who confesses finds mercy.'

choices.text: Blame someone else if questioned
choices.verse: Colossians 3:9 - 'Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices...'

choices.description: A friend considering abortion asks your opinion. She's terrified but you believe life begins at conception...

choices.text: Offer to adopt the baby
choices.verse: Psalm 139:13-14 - 'You knit me together in my mother’s womb...' + Practical James 2:16

choices.text: Share your view but respect her choice
choices.verse: Proverbs 31:8 - 'Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves...'

choices.text: Avoid involvement - 'Not my business'
choices.verse: Ezekiel 33:6 - 'If the watchman sees danger coming and doesn’t warn... I will hold accountable.'

choices.description: You discover your purchased clothes were made in sweatshops. Returning them would leave you with little to wear...

choices.text: Return everything and research ethical brands
choices.verse: Amos 8:4-6 - 'Hear this, you who trample the needy...' + 1 Corinthians 10:24

choices.text: Keep items but boycott the brand
choices.verse: Micah 6:8 - 'Act justly, love mercy, walk humbly...'

choices.text: Rationalize - 'My choice won't change anything'
choices.verse: Luke 16:10 - 'Whoever is faithful with little will be faithful with much...'

choices.description: Your wealthy uncle offers a lucrative job that would require working Sundays. Your church needs you...

choices.text: Decline - 'I honor Sabbath rest'
choices.verse: Exodus 20:8-10 - 'Remember the Sabbath...' + Mark 2:27 ('Sabbath made for man')

choices.text: Negotiate partial Sundays off
choices.verse: Matthew 6:24 - 'No one can serve two masters...'

choices.text: Accept - 'Money helps more people'
choices.verse: 1 Timothy 6:10 - 'Love of money is root of all evil...'

endings.title: Full of Grace
endings.message: Your heart mirrors Christ’s love—sacrificial, relentless, and transformative.

endings.title: Growing In Love
endings.message: You care deeply but sometimes hesitate. Keep seeking His kingdom first!
endings.verse: 1 John 4:19 - 'We love because He first loved us.'

endings.title: Seeking Light
endings.message: You're on the path but need courage to surrender fully. His grace is enough!
endings.verse: 1 John 4:19 - 'We love because He first loved us.'

endings.title: Broken Vessel
endings.message: You’re on the path but need courage to surrender fully. His grace is enough!
endings.verse: 'Return to me, and I will restore you.' (Jeremiah 15:19)
